Author: gcharang#6833
Content: `masternode implementation` is a possibility for assetchains that have CryptoConditions enabled. The `rewards` part of it has been written in its simplest form and needs to be tested. The other parts of a `masternode` might come in the future. All of this is currently in development and can be followed in the #cc-general channel.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: what about masternodes makes them popular?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: from what I have heard it is the ability to lock funds to earn rewards and all the other parts of the masternode is not really that much of interest.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if somebody can precisely describe what more than pure rewards CC is needed for a "masternode" CC, I can think about implementing it

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: from what I read masternodes are like PoS stakers, they validate blocks and earn the tx fees and/or stake new coins

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: for that network

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: though there are many variants

Author: Gordon Komodo#7477
Content: MGN/MGNX masternode has governance voting and of course the reward as well ( 80% rewards goes to node holder)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: CC is not in a position to validate blocks (without major overhaul which I wont do), but it can deal with most other aspects

Author: Gordon Komodo#7477
Content: dash has private send and instant send features on masternode

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: all KMD chains have private send

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: instant send is not really something CC can do

Author: Gordon Komodo#7477
Content: probably can be implemented like zeroconf?
